name: Double Robotics
headline: Telepresence robots
description:
Double Robotics is the creator of Double, the world’s leading telepresence robot. We help telecommuters feel more connected to their colleagues by giving them a physical presence wherever they need to be.

Having your own Double in the office means you can be free to roam around anywhere without scheduling a call or meeting. Double takes everything you love about video calls on an iPad and places that on a mobile base that puts the remote worker in control. By combining cutting edge technology with an intuitive, elegant design, Double is the ultimate tool for telecommuters. 

Our mission is to connect the world through remote experiences. 

http://www.doublerobotics.com
info@doublerobotics.com

[Hybrid Office](https://doublerobotics.com/</business/>) [Hybrid Classroom](https://doublerobotics.com/</education/>) [Customer Stories](https://doublerobotics.com/</stories/>) [Features](https://doublerobotics.com/</double3.html>) [Fleet Management](https://doublerobotics.com/</fleet-management.html>)
[](https://doublerobotics.com/</> "Double Robotics Logo")
# Double 3
## The future of work is hybrid.
  * ![Self-Driving icon](https://doublerobotics.com/img2/_2x/d3-self-driving-hd.png)Self-Driving
  * ![Mixed Reality icon](https://doublerobotics.com/img2/_2x/d3-target-hd.png)Mixed Reality
  * ![Pan Tilt Zoom icon](https://doublerobotics.com/img2/_2x/d3-ptz-hd.png)Pan–Tilt–Zoom


![Double 3 telepresence robot](https://doublerobotics.com/img2/_2x/d3-hero-hd.png)
Sold Out
Double 3 is a self-driving, two-wheeled videoconferencing robot that revolutionizes the way you work or learn remotely. With more and more employers allowing flexible or remote schedules, these **hybrid offices** and **hybrid classrooms** need tools designed for this environment. Double 3 is the ultimate tool for remote workers and students to feel more connected to their colleagues by giving them a physical presence where they can’t be in person.
![Robot images from front and side](https://doublerobotics.com/img2/_2x/d3-features-transparent-hd.png)
![Robot feature highlights](https://doublerobotics.com/img2/_2x/d3-features-text-transparent-hd.png)
![Robot feature highlights](https://doublerobotics.com/img2/_2x/d3-features-text-transparent-hd.png)
### Self-Driving
![Short video of robot driving in warehouse](https://doublerobotics.com/files/D3-Warehouse-2-medium.gif)
An array of 3D sensors enables Double 3 to understand its environment, where it’s safe to drive, and how to divert around obstacles to reach the destination. Obstacle avoidance means that completely untrained drivers can drive Double 3 without fear of bumping into walls or people.
### Click-to-Drive
Dots are drawn on the floor where Double 3 can safely drive. The driver can click anywhere on the floor and the robot will go there, avoiding obstacles along the way.
Mixed Reality is like Augmented Reality, except virtual 3D objects are added into the video stream, and they look like they are placed in the real world. They help you understand what your Double can see, and they highlight important waypoints and objects of interest, such as the Charging Dock.
![Short video of robot camera zooming](https://doublerobotics.com/files/D3-Warehouse-1-small.gif)
### Unified Pan-Tilt-Zoom
Two 13 Megapixel cameras provide an ultra wide field of view and multiple levels of zoom. The cameras can physically tilt up and down, which is helpful for reading papers on a desk or zooming into a specific point.
Already own Double 2? [Upgrade with a Double 3 head!](https://doublerobotics.com/<upgrade.html>)
[See more features...](https://doublerobotics.com/<double3.html>)
## Colors
User-replaceable silicone rubber trim with 5 colors available
![Blue, ping, green, red, and black colored robots](https://doublerobotics.com/img2/_2x/d3-colors-hd.jpg)
![Photo of robot in machine shop](https://doublerobotics.com/img2/standard/d3-shop-no-text.jpg)
[Support](https://doublerobotics.com/<https:/support.doublerobotics.com>) [FAQ](https://doublerobotics.com/</faq.html>) [Distributors](https://doublerobotics.com/</distributors.html>) [Developer](https://doublerobotics.com/</developer.html>) [Privacy](https://doublerobotics.com/</privacy.html>)
© 2025 Double Robotics, Inc.

generated_description:
Double Robotics, founded in 2012 and hailing from Burlingame, CA, is on the cutting edge of remote communication technology with its flagship product, the Double—one of the world’s leading telepresence robots. The company is dedicated to enhancing how telecommuters connect and collaborate with their colleagues, effectively making the remote workplace feel less remote.

The Double is essentially a mobile videoconferencing system on wheels. Picture this: instead of being tethered to a desk during video calls, you can move freely around your workspace, interacting with your team as if you were all in the same room. It combines advanced technology and user-friendly design, making it the ultimate tool for anyone working from home. This innovation doesn’t just make remote work possible; it makes it vibrant and engaging.

As part of its mission, Double Robotics aims to create a more connected world through these remote experiences. With a team of 11 talented employees and support from Y Combinator (Batch S12), the company is pushing the boundaries of what's possible in hybrid working environments. Their latest model, the Double 3, exemplifies this commitment. It offers features like self-driving capabilities, pan-tilt-zoom cameras, and a mixed reality interface—transforming how remote team members interact in real-time.

In a world that increasingly embraces flexible work schedules, Double Robotics is positioning itself as a leader in this shift, providing the tools necessary for hybrid offices and classrooms. With the ability to navigate autonomously and a robust feature set designed for ease of use, it’s clear that they are not just part of the conversation about remote work—they are reshaping it.

For more information, you can visit their website [here](https://doublerobotics.com) or reach out via email at info@doublerobotics.com.
